Package voltage.utility

Class SmoothValue

java.lang.Object
voltage.utility.SmoothValue
public class SmoothValue
extends java.lang.Object
A simple class that lets you smoothly transition from one value to another. This will help avoid stair stepping and drastic fluxuations. For example, this is used in the Glide module where you can smoothly transition from one value to another over a specific amount of time.

    • SmoothValue

      public SmoothValue​(double startValue)
      Constructs a SmoothValue object
      Parameters:
      startValue - the first value to add.

  • Method Details

    • SetGlideTime

      public void SetGlideTime​(double glideMilliseconds)
      Sets the amount of time to move to the destination value. For example: SetGlideTime(1000.0) then will take 1 second to glide from one value to another, regardless of the difference between the current value and the destination value.
      Parameters:
      glideMilliseconds - time in milliseconds.

    • SetFixedTime

      public void SetFixedTime​(double glideMilliseconds, double deltaValue)
      Sets a fixed amount to glide to in a fixed amount of time. For example: SetFixedTime(1000, 1.0) will take 1 second to glide a distance of 1.0. Meaning a change from 0 to 5.0 would take 5 seconds.
      Parameters:
      glideMilliseconds - time in milliseconds.
      deltaValue - the amount to change in glideMilliseconds.

    • SetValue

      public void SetValue​(double newValue)
      Sets a new target value.
      Parameters:
      newValue - the new destination target.

    • ResetValue

      public void ResetValue​(double newValue)
      Sets the current and destination value to be the same value.
      Parameters:
      newValue - the new value to set the destination and current value to.

    • GetValue

      public double GetValue()
      Gets the current smoothed value of this object.

      the current smoothed value.
